title: Bank of Korea cuts benchmark lending rate by 25 basis points in a surprise move
description: This surprised economists polled by Reuters, which expected the BOK to hold rates.
excerpt: This surprised economists polled by Reuters, which expected the BOK to hold rates.
text: A pedestrian walks past signage for the Bank of Korea in Seoul, South Korea, on Monday, Nov. 22, 2021.SeongJoon Cho | Bloomberg | Getty ImagesSouth Korea's central bank on Thursday cut its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 3% in a surprise move.Economists polled by Reuters had estimated the bank to hold rates at 3.25%.This is the second straight cut as the Bank of Korea lowered rates by 25 basis points in its last meeting in October as well.Stock Chart IconStock chart iconThe Kospi stock index was up 0.18%, while the South Korean fell 0.37% to trade at 1,393.82 against the U.S. dollar.This is breaking news, please check back for updates.
html:
A pedestrian walks past signage for the Bank of Korea in Seoul, South Korea, on Monday, Nov. 22, 2021.

SeongJoon Cho | Bloomberg | Getty Images

South Korea's central bank on Thursday cut its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 3% in a surprise move.

Economists polled by Reuters had estimated the bank to hold rates at 3.25%.

This is the second straight cut as the Bank of Korea lowered rates by 25 basis points in its last meeting in October as well.

The Kospi stock index was up 0.18%, while the South Korean fell 0.37% to trade at 1,393.82 against the U.S. dollar.

This is breaking news, please check back for updates.
